summary: Email correspondence from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York regarding the service of a trial subpoena for school records in an unspecified case. The email chain discusses tracking down and serving a subpoena to a school, with instructions to handle confidentiality issues.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, instructing the recipient to serve a trial subpoena to a school for records and offering to handle confidentiality issues.

events.title: Trial Subpoena Issued for School Records
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends an email with an attached subpoena to be served to a school to obtain school records for an unspecified individual.

events.title: Follow-up on Subpoena Service
events.description: Follow-up email sent asking if the trial subpoena for school records had been served.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from August 2021 involving an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York.
The correspondence concerns serving a trial subpoena to a school to obtain school records for an individual.
The prosecutor instructs the recipient to handle the service and offers to address any confidentiality concerns raised by the school.
